channel.title: Where do i start?
channel.description: Hi my name is piiiwiii and i want to get into programming like making commands and coding but i dont know where to start the thing i only have is notepad ++ and i want to code with that so could you guys give me like a practising software or something thanks. :P

item.title: Where do i start?
item.dc:creator: @Integer Integer_
item.description:
@Integer wrote:

If you want game design i suggest c++, although java is good, it doesn’t have all the options c++ does, (please dont get into a heated discussion here!). Decide, if for RSPS editing most things in RSPS may just be making a constructor and doing a few loops, maybe array lists and such, but nothing very advanced. Great place to start programming is here
“http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/java/tutorials/j-introtojava1/index.html” because there are two parts, and other more advanced stuff will be covered in resources. Good luck!

Read full topic

item.title: Where do i start?
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:9, topic:413531”]http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4175712/Thinking_In_Java_(4th_Edition)__by_Bruce_Eckel

Good book, learnt a lot from this.[/quote]

http://books.google.com/books/about/A_short_introduction_to_English_grammar.html?id=tqgifS7RsAkC

I learned a lot from this.

On topic, program design structure, conventions, sequence design, control structure, ect.

item.title: Where do i start?

Start with simple System.out.print.ln(""); lines, via command prompt, then move on to bigger and better things.
[/quote]

…even though there is no period in println[/quote]
ik i always put it there for some reason…

item.title: Where do i start?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

IDE stands for Integrated Development Environment, it has lot’s of tools and features built in to aid you in programming. Some common IDE’s designed for the Java programming language are Netbeans, Eclipse, and IntelliJ IDEA. If you want bare minimum, though, you can use something like Vim which is a console based text editor that has things like syntax highlighting built in. Also this will help you in learning the actual Java language, assuming that is what you want to learn.

Read full topic
